conclusion: Initial state A temperature is 27°C or 300 K
Process A→B is an isobaric decrease in volume (vertical line down)
Process B→C is an isothermal expansion (horizontal line)
State A has pressure 3×10⁵ Pa and volume 1×10⁻³ m³
State B has pressure 1×10⁵ Pa and volume 1×10⁻³ m³
State C has pressure 1×10⁵ Pa and volume 3×10⁻³ m³
Temperature at state B is calculated as 100 K
Heat transferred during A→B is -200nCᵥ, indicating heat release
Temperature at state C is 100 K, same as state B
Heat transferred during B→C is calculated as approximately 109.86nR
Total heat transferred is calculated for different gas types
Specific heat capacities for monatomic, diatomic, and polyatomic gases are given
Total heat transferred for a monatomic gas is -190.14nR joules
Total heat transferred for a diatomic gas is -390.14nR joules
Total heat transferred for a polyatomic gas is -490.14nR joules
Negative sign indicates heat release by the gas during the process
